Hello and thank you for visiting.

Recently, I've been thinking about the possibility of starting on a fabulous new career of stalking but realized that I didn't know anyone worthy of my soon to be acquired stalker skills. So I thought, "what better place to start than with a post on craigslist". Below is a list of qualifications I would look for in my potential stalkee. Stalkette? Okay, I haven't got all the vocabulary down, but I'm sure we can work on it together. After all, we will be spending lots of nights alone together.


First, you should probably think of yourself as cute/pretty/pleasing/easy on the eyes/etc. Well, of course, I'll think of you as insanely gorgeous, but if you think you look like a donkey, it probably won't work out. My friends (both stalker and non-stalker) will frown upon me stalking someone who thinks she looks like a donkey.

Second, and equally as important, you should have all your teeth. Preferably not in a jar. Only because I have my own jar and think it best if I collect your teeth for you. Eventually, maybe I can make a necklace from them. Is that too much? Do you prefer earrings?

It would be slightly more convenient if you were not taller than 5'6" (that's 3" shorter than me, in case you need to tell the police). It's another one of those unspoken stalker rules that a stalker not be shorter than a stalkee. Plus, I wouldn't want to have to wear your heels just to see eye to eye with you. You know the pair - the ones that have been missing for a month?

Okay, this one's not a deal breaker, but should be noted. It's probably best if you're not older than 36. And it's probably better, legally, if you're at least 18. It's all about being on the up and up, right?

For the most part, you're happy with life. But mainly it's material things; where you live, your job, your house, your family; its hard to complain because you feel you have so much but despite all that there is something missing; something very significant. After all, having nice things only goes so far, ultimately we all need companionship with someone that you know thinks you're important, that you care about and you know they care about you. Someone that when you think about him, your heart races, every time your phone alerts that you have a text or email you find yourself wishing it will be from him. When it actually is you can't help but smile. With great anticipation and excitement you read every message he sends. He is always so kind, asking about you first, complementing you on how you look, that awesome recent accomplishment you had at work, that milestone you reached in the gym or doing something that you value and is important to you. When you finally have time and space to meet n person its hard to control yourself. Your heart flutters when you see him, you get butterflies in your stomach, its like you've gone back in time to when you first had a crush on someone and that person crushed you back. He is so handsome, takes care of himself and has that amazing smile. You love spending time together because you always have fun, always laugh, nothing ever seems mundane, boring, every time you meet there is new excitement. The passionate moments you share are like nothing you've ever experienced. You never imagined someone could make you feel the way he does. Your chemistry knows no bounds and constantly finds ways to surprise you in amazing ways. Sometimes you think, why couldn't we have met a decade ago but you didn't and you realize that's okay. Right now you just want to live each day, enjoy life and value every moment you have together. You can't change your life situation right now, so many complicated things, so many people to consider but you can give yourself a slice of happiness when you want it-- when you need it. Everyone deserves to be happy. Sometimes we make mistakes in life, sometimes people change, sometimes circumstances change and suddenly life didn't turn out how we thought it would. But maybe, just maybe, there's someone out there that understands, someone that you feel a connection with, someone that bridges the void lying between you and ultimate happiness. Whether you are 25 or 40, life can change at any moment for the better or for the worse, why not make it change for the better today? If this post shines back a reflection of hope and excitement for you then send me an email. Maybe today ends up being the day you chose happiness. The Untold Truth Behind Therapy

The truth is that the most common treatment is role playing, for the therapist to be a healthy role model. They are able to do this by taking their own personal emotions out of your interactions. That why family members are not allowed to treat family members. No matter how strong your bond is with your therapist it was created through manipulation and money based. In fact the stronger your bond is the better the manipulation and treatment is working. This treatment is very underlying. 

I was a victim of this treatment and I say victim because it is undisclosed to you when entering treatment. My role play three therapist took part in, and my primary care doctor. Another doctor that I reached out to for help later chimed in. It left me feeling delusional with manufactured events that had a really bad affect on me when I was abruptly snapped out of this role play after six months into it. I told my therapist if she was doing anything underlining to please stop. I was Struggling to get a grasp on it while my therapist and her colleagues she shared office spare with persisted with another aspect of her underlining treatment. I didn't ask for this treatment and did not recognize it as treatment. I thought they were making fun of me. At least that's what it felt like and it was very hurtful. I just couldn't take it anymore and my therapist was all for me turning myself into the hospital, until I got there and doctors told me she had made mistakes, that was even scarier.

I could go on and on about this nightmare I lived, but I would rather not. My purpose of writing this is to warn others of this because when it goes wrong other therapist and doctors are quick to come to each others rescue. Basically you are wrong matter what. No matter how their actions affect you. 

My therapist always told me how honest I was, how sweet, how generous, how caring and even called me an angel. She even told me she would see me for free right before she told me to call my insurance company for a new billing code. Now that her actions had such a bad affect on me and were so damaging other therapist are making me out to be a malicious lair despite the fact that all of this is documented in my records that they have access to. They would rather make me out to be a liar then admit this so commonly used treatment had such a bad effect on me and a colleague did wrong. They are more concerned with defending a colleagues actions then offering a victim of this treatment help. 

After this experience I've been waiting for over a year for any kind of help while parties involved covered their actions as much as possible. I sincerely want the public to be aware of this treatment and hopefully my experience will help others. Maybe I can stop this from happening to someone else. Who knows how many times it happened already. I am left feeling worthless considering that professionals could do all of this to me and I have little to no rights. This shouldn't have happen to me and I don't want this to happen to anyone else. You don't have to take my word for it. All you have to do is question your treatment provider and you should be smart enough to see that my words are true.

I would like to thank everyone for all the supportive email I have and you're welcome for the warning.

I'm a married white male whose wife cannot stand how extreme I am when it comes to shopping.

I'm in search of that 1 in a million person with whom I can shop with.
* and that is going to be really slim since the population of Rhode Island
is just over 1 million people and more than half are under 21

Posting in RI but open to Massachusetts residents as well

I am not looking for a relationship.
(I've got one of those)

I'm not looking for sex.
(I get enough of that)

I am looking for someone who is actually serious about couponing and stockpiling.
Someone who has knowledge or is sincerely eager to learn.

I am not looking to pay for companionship.

I am not looking to go to a site to enter my credit card information.

I don't even want to see a photo of you.
[in or out of your clothes]



Here I will lay out my quirks/requirements some are set in stone others are bendable

- Currently I am a cigarette smoker, this is not going to change anytime soon
( I just lost 75% of the people that had some interest there)

Looking preferably for a female because "most" women have a better business sense, and photographic memory, and are better at math.
I will consider a male couponer friend but sincerity is a must.

you must be over 21; as some of the items that we may be purchasing could be age restricted
there is no upper age limit, so long as you are able to focus (have all your faculties )
(I just lost another 20% of people that had some interest with the above statement)

English is one of your languages, that you can speak and understand
(just lost another 2% of people that had some interest)

You do not suffer from Panic attacks; (some stores cashiers do not understand their store policy; or make up policies as they go along = that is when we ask to speak to a manager; and sometimes recite their store policy to them)
(just lost another 2% of people that had some interest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If your still reading then you are sincere and in the 1%
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
below requirements are not set in stone;

Access to a computer (win/mac) and a printer (optional)
access to a smart phone (optional)
access to coupons (I can guide you to places where you can accumulate them)
Have a vehicle so we can share the driving; or use separate vehicles to collect our hauls
(some hauls may consist of large items paper towels ect. so a small car like a two seater bmw would not be practical)

I can help with the following
- organization of your coupons
- finding deals of the week
- liquidating excess of the items that you buy and do not need (I will tell you up front before we do any buying, what I will be willing to pay for items that we purchase on the shopping trip - because every week we will be buying different items and accumulating them as my inventory goes up my interest goes down)
- help you with repricing of the items if you intend on reselling them.

I resell most of the items that I buy, I own a retail store in Massachusetts and sell items online as well, so I have outlets for the items that I stockpile.

So if you are a novice at couponing, or really want to learn how to save money then you have nothing to lose and all to gain by contacting me.
If you are a career couponer who is doing it for profit (Wickham) then I might not be as advanced as you are, and we might not be compatible.

If you think that couponing down to 0.00 or less than 0.00 (where they pay you money to take items out of the store) is wrong, then we would definitely not be a match

Is that too much to ask?
Thank you for reading

Walking into the theater amidst the quiet murmurs of the audience. You trudge through the stands, searching for a seat as a slow feeling of excitement forms in your body, alongside the dimming lights... The warm smell of popcorn filling the air, as all sounds around you slowly come to a halt; the quiet, before you are transported to another world. And then you feel it. That wonderful indistinct feeling inside, as you know what's about to occur. 

It's time. The familiar sensations of dread, tension, and exhilaration permeate your body, as you prepare for what you know is about to happen.
The movie begins.
